attributes.action: Increase the Bill of Rights Bill majority
attributes.background: The new Bill of Rights Bill should require a majority vote of 2/3 instead of just a simple majority of one as required with other laws.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about the Bill of Rights Bill becoming law, but all bills go through the same legislative process, and there are no provisions in UK law for legislation to require a 'supermajority'.

You can find out more about how a bill becomes a law here: https://www.parliament.uk/about/how/laws/passage-bill/

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Do not reform the Human Rights Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607712
